articles.name: Clone Digital Library Content (Released Tuesday, September 11, 2020)
articles.title: Clone Digital Library Content (Released Tuesday, September 11, 2020)
articles.body:
The Digital Library now supports the ability to clone content items.  This functionality can be used to clone or duplicate a a single content item, a folder and its containing content items, or disparate content items in bulk.

Steps to Clone Content Items

  1. Click Clone Content Button
    Inside the Digital Library, click either the Clone Content button in the upper left of the clone content icon at the very right of any respective content item row listing.  Generally, the Clone Content button button in the upper left is used for cloning multiple items at once, where the individual icon is for cloning the single item.


  2. Select Items to Clone
    After clicking either the Clone Content button or clone content icon, a modal dialog will open. You must first select the content to clone.  If you clicked the icon, the respective piece of content will be selected by default.  Clicking the Clone Content button will present no selected items by default.  In both cases, you may browse the My Library section in the left hand side, and click to select any number of content items to duplicate.  When selected, the content item(s) to be cloned will be shown in the right hand column labeled Selected Content.


  3. Select Destination
    The next screen is to choose where the newly-cloned content items will be placed.  You may browse in the left hand column to select the folder into which the cloned items will be set.  By default, the top level or My Library folder will be selected.  The right hand column will display the name (which in this example is My Library) of the selected folder destination.


  4. Set Availability
    The availability type to apply to all cloned content items.  This impacts which (if any) patients will have access to this content in the mobile app.

Additional Notes

Some additional notes regarding the functionality:

  • Cloned content ownership
    Once a content is cloned, the new item will be owned by the currently-selected clinic.  For multi-tier and group clinics which have inherited content, the new cloned copies are then manageable under this new clinic.  This allows the name, description, and availability settings to be edited.
  • Cloned content naming
    When a content item is cloned, the destination may already have a content item with that same title.  Similarly to copying folders or files on a computer, the newly-cloned content item will have a number appended to its name (e.g. Folder (1), Folder (2)) to prevent naming collisions.
  • Cloned content availability
    The last step when cloning content items is to set availability (public, private, by phase), which impacts which patients have access to this content in the mobile application.  Regardless of how many items are selected during that cloning process, all content items will use the selected value.  If you are cloning multiple items at once, but would like to adjust specific content items' availability, you must adjust the availability after the cloning is complete.  Do this by browsing the content items and adjusting each content items' availability as needed

articles.name: Weight Threshold Alert (Released Wednesday, July 29, 2020)
articles.title: Weight Threshold Alert (Released Wednesday, July 29, 2020)
articles.body:
The Weight Threshold alert type is now available for use by all clinics on the platform. This alert generates a notification when a patient's weight falls outside of a pre-defined threshold over a certain number of days  Along with the four other alerts (Weight Regain, Meal Inactivity, Scale Inactivity, and Tracker Inactivity), this alert provides automated feedback and notifications regarding patient progress.

You may setup the Weight Threshold alert for your clinic on the dashboard under Alerts->Settings in the left-hand menu.  Unlike the other four alerts, the Weight Threshold alert has the following five settings:

  1. Gain Window
    The number of pounds or kilograms gained, at or beyond which which an alert notification is generated.
    • Example If the Gain Window is set to 3 lbs, once a patient has gained at least three pounds during the Weight Threshold alert's day span setting, an alert is generated. 
  2. Loss Window
    The number of pounds or kilograms lost, at or below which an alert notification is generated.
    • Example If the Loss Window is set to 3 lbs, once a patient has lost at least three pounds during the Weight Threshold alert's day span setting, an alert is generated. 
  3. Day Span
    The number of consecutive days to examine for weight change.  This is essentially the window of time for which a weight change will be examined.  The first and last recorded weights within this number of consecutive days will be examined.
  4. Require Daily Measurement
    If a weight measurement is required for each day of the day span period. If this is set to 'No', then at least two separate days must have a recorded weight. Otherwise, the alert notification will only be generated if every day has a recorded weight.
    • Example 1 The Weight Threshold Alert has a Day Span of '5 days', and 'Require Daily Measurement' set to 'Yes'. A patient must have a recorded weight for each of the 5 days in order for an alert notification to be potentially generated.
    • Example 2 The Weight Threshold Alert has a Day Span of '5 days', and 'Require Daily Measurement' set to 'No'.  A patient must have a recorded weight on at least two separate days of the alert in order for an alert notification to be potentially generated.
      • Using this setting, be aware that weight can be recorded for any two days within the day span window.  For example, if the day span is set for 20 days, a user could record weights on (for example) day 19 and 20 only, and the alert may be triggered.
  5. Trigger Period
    Generate an alert notification up to each calendar day, or up to once only at the end of the 'Day Span' setting.
    • Example 1 The alert has a 'Day Span' setting of 7 days and a 'Trigger Period' of 'Daily'. An alert could potentially be generated on each day of the week, as each calendar day begins a new 7 day window.
    • Example 2 The alert has a 'Day Span' setting of 7 days and a 'Trigger Period' of 'Only at end of period'. An alert notification may be generated up once per week, as each 'Day Span' is a unique and non-overlapping period.

articles.name: Patient Clinical Report (Released Monday, July 20, 2020)
articles.title: Patient Clinical Report (Released Monday, July 20, 2020)
articles.body:
A one page Patient Clinic Report can now be downloaded from each patients' profile page.  The report summarizes a patient's activity over a specific time period.  The generated file is designed to be utilized as additional documentation for a patient when submitting claims for Remote Patient Monitoring.

Location and How to Download

 A Download Report button is presented at the top of the 'Dashboard' tab of a patient's profile.  This new button is available on all patient profiles.

When the Download Report button is clicked, a dialog is presented with options for downloading the report.  Keep in mind that the report is composed of information for a single patient, and includes a summary of data collected over a specific time period.

  • Start Date The starting date from which to include data calculated in the report
  • End Date The ending date until which to include data calculated in the report
  • Format The file format to download the report, either PDF or Excel

Description of Report

Both formats of the report (PDF or Excel) will contain the same information.  The screenshots included below are from the PDF version, but small differences in presentation and formatting may exist between the two versions.

Dates of Service

The first item presented in the report is of the Dates of Service.  These dates will correspond to the Start Date and End Date selected in the Download Patient Report dialog.

Patient Care Plan

This section applies to patients enrolled in Remote Patient Monitoring (RPM).  If the patient has never had RPM enabled, some of these fields may be left blank.  If RPM has been activated and deactivated multiple times for a patient, the data presented in this section relates to the most recent RPM activation and deactivation.

  • Care Plan Type If RPM was enabled for a patient, it will show RPM as the care plan.  Otherwise, it will be blank
  • Status The current status of RPM for the patient, either Active or Inactive.
  • Activation Date The date which RPM was activated for the patient.
  • Target Deactivation Date The date RPM was projected or intended to be deactivated for this patient.  This date would have been optionally selected by a provider.  It corresponds to the anticipated date at which the patient was expected to achieve their goals as per the use of RPM.  Depending on the activation date, this date may be in the past or future.
  • Actual Deactivation Date The date RPM was most recently deactivated for this patient (if available).
  • Reason for Deactivation The justification as to why RPM was turned off for a patient.
  • Consent Obtained If the patient's consent to enable RPM for their account was obtained before RPM was activated. This question is asked when RPM is enabled for a patient's account.
  • Face-to-face within 12 months If the provider and patient had a face-to-face meeting within the last 12 months.  This question is asked when RPM is enabled for a patient's account.
  • Device Supplied If a device used to electronically collect daily measurements was supplied to the patient.  This question is asked when RPM is enabled for a patient's account.
  • Device Education Supplied If instruction on how to use the supplied device was provided.  This question is asked when RPM is enabled for a patient's account.

Patient Data

This information relates to patient activity.  It provides starting and ending values for each metric or area, along with the amount and percent of change between those two values.  In addition, it reports the count of unique days in which that data or data within that category was saved by the patient.

Each metric (Weight, BMI, Carbs, etc) is presented in a similar structure:

  • Unit The unit of measurement used to record and track this metric
  • Start The earliest recorded measurement for this metric, within the selected date range for this report
  • End The last recorded measurement for this metric, within the selected date range for this report
  • Unit Change The change in units between the start and end values in this row
  • Percent Change The percent of change in units between the start and end values in this row
  • Total Transmission Days The number of unique or distinct days, during the selected time period, in which data in this category was recorded.

Specific notes regarding each column are as follows:

  • Weight
    • Shown in either pounds of kilograms, as per the provider's profile preferences that generated the report
    • If RPM is enabled for a patient, the Total Transmission Days also includes the unique/distinct days in which the automatic RPM notification to weigh in was received by the patient.  To clarify, a specific day will contribute either 0 or 1 to the total count, and will be 1 if a specific day included with a recorded weight, the receipt of the automatic notification to weigh in, or a recorded weight and receipt of the automatic notification to weigh in.
  • BMI
    • If RPM is enabled for a patient, the Total Transmission Days also includes the unique/distinct days in which the automatic RPM notification to weigh in was received by the patient.  To clarify, a specific day will contribute either 0 or 1 to the total count, and will be 1 if a specific day included with a recorded BMI, the receipt of the automatic notification to weigh in, or a recorded BMI and receipt of the automatic notification to weigh in.
  • Supplements
    • The unit of measurement is supplements per day.  For a particular supplement, it will be recorded either 0 or 1 times per day.  Further, it will be recorded as 1 only if the minimum daily target was recorded.  For example, if a supplement is listed as intended to be taken 3 times a day, it will only be recorded as 1 if that supplement was taken at least 3 times on that day.

Provider Activity

This final segment reports on provider interactions with this patient.  Data from any provider within the clinic is included in the numbers: 

  • Calls (Audio/Video)
    • Patient Interactions The number of calls this patient has engaged in with any provider within the clinic over the selected date range.
    • Time The total number of minutes the patient spent in audio/video calls over the selected time period.
  • Data Monitoring
    • Patient Interactions This number will always be 0
    • Time The total amount of time any provider within the clinic spent viewing any portion of the patient's profile on the provider dashboard during the selected time period.
  • Messages
    • Patient Interactions The number of unique messages sent and received by this patient over the selected time period
    • Time This number will always be 0
  • Total
    • Patient Interactions The sum of the first three rows' Patient Interactions values
    • Time The sum of the first three rows' Time values, in minutes

articles.name: Video Conference Enhancements (Released Beginning Tuesday, May 19, 2020)
articles.title: Video Conference Enhancements (Released Beginning Tuesday, May 19, 2020)
articles.body:
The mobile application is configured for your clinic.  Some or all of the features discussed here may not be available in your clinic's app.  Further, an updated version of the app must be published to both the Google Play and iOS stores for new features to become available.  The timeline for this release is custom to your clinic.  Please contact support if you have any questions.

Beginning Tuesday May 19, 2020, the following video conference enhancements will be released for general availability to all clinics:

Improved Incoming Call Notifications
Signal Strength Indicator
Speakerphone Toggle Button

Improved Incoming Call Notifications

Patients using the mobile app will now have a much more prominent notification of an incoming video conference call from their coach.  The follow notifications will show full screen on iOS and Android respectively, displaying the name of the coach which is contacting the patient:

iOS Incoming Notification      Android Incoming Notification
 

Some additional notes and considerations regarding this improvement:

  • "App Permissions" Updated
    The "App Permissions" section of the app (within the lefthand menu) has been updated to include the additional permission checks needed for these full screen notifications.  If a mobile app user does not have the appropriate app and phone permissions granted, they will see a red notification badge and appropriate 'app permission' instruction.
  • "Do Not Disturb" Takes Precedence
    Both iOS and Android have a do not disturb feature which disables or suppresses notifications.  These settings are customizable for each user, but will impact this incoming call notification. 
  • Android Notification Screen May Vary
    Each Android phone manufacturer (Samsung, Google, LG, HTC, etc...) makes variations to the underlying Android code.  As such, the incoming call notification screen may vary for users.  Most likely, this will be to show either:
    • The name and email address of the coach
    • The phone number +1 (833) 926 2242, which is an outgoing phone number only
  • iOS Supported Devices
    Only iPhones, iPads, and iPod Touch Devices released in the last few years will fully support this improved incoming notification.  Due to performance issues, older devices (released prior to 2017) will continue to display the current notification if the app is in the background, the app is completely closed, or the phone is locked.

Signal Strength Indicator

A small signal strength icon indicator will now be shown in the upper left hand corner of the other call participant's video feed or avatar:

Mobile App (Patient View)      Dashboard (Coach View)
 

The icon indicates the quality of the audio and video being received by your computer or phone from the other user.  One of three statuses will be shown:

  • Good Quality indicates 80% or more of the audio and video is being received

  •  Fair Quality indicates 30% or more of the audio and video is being received

  •   Poor Quality indicates less than 30% of the audio and video is being received

If the quality remains poor for an extended period, the call may unexpectedly drop or disconnect.  In addition, to assist in troubleshooting and customer support, the underlying system will now track when calls enter poor quality.

Speakerphone Toggle Button

For both iOS and Android users in the mobile app, a speakerphone toggle button has been added to the active call window:

When the button is clicked, it will toggle the speakerphone speaker on or off.

It is important to note that there is a limitation on iOS devices that, when headphones are connected, speakerphone cannot be toggled on or off.  In this case (when headphones are connected to an iOS device) this button will be disabled.
